Alert Name: bush
Ethanol group denies blame for food inflation
The Renewable Fuels Association says surging oil and gas prices are driving up the cost of U.S. groceries.
06/14/07 04:02 PM, EDT
Blame surging oil and gasoline prices for driving up the cost of U.S. groceries, the ethanol industry said Thursday, defending itself from charges that the corn price spike was making food more expensive.
